image.altText: An entrance to an airport reading "Welcome to Rome".

props.synopsis: It was a Wednesday morning in Rome when Italian police received an Interpol red notice from Victorian police. Within two days, Perry Kouroumblis would be under arrest for the killings of two Australian women almost five decades ago.

title.children: When Italian police received a red alert on a wanted man all the way from Melbourne, they got to work fast

image.altText: Katy Perry wears a heavy navy jacket and clear rimmed glasses and crouches beside a brown fluffy penguin.

props.synopsis: Things were a bit icy when the two biggest celebrities in Melbourne this week met ahead of the AFL grand final.

title.children: When Katy met Pesto: A pop megastar meets a mega-sized penguin

image.altText: Brodie Grundy and Oscar McInerney contest for the ball during an AFL match between the Sydney Swans and Brisbane Lions

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans will take on the Brisbane Lions today, with Katy Perry providing pre-show entertainment at the MCG.

title.children: AFL grand final start time and how to watch the game

image.altText: A woman in a kitchen looking at the camera with an old-style stove behind her

props.synopsis: From peeling wallpaper and a cellar left mouldy from floodwater, this couple has restored a circa-1881 Victorian mansion into a grand attraction with some modern-day living features.

title.children: Couple lovingly restores abandoned 19th-century 'money pit' into grand Victorian mansion

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes of the Melbourne Storm sticks his tongue out as he runs with the football in an NRL game against the Roosters.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Storm are the first team through to the NRL grand final after a thumping 48-18 win over the Sydney Roosters, but face a nervous wait after Nelson Asofa-Solomona was put on report for a high shot.

title.children: Jahrome Hughes shreds Roosters to send Melbourne Storm into another NRL grand final

image.altText: Hundreds of people form a circle around an image of a whale tale made of seaweed on the beach

props.synopsis: Three-line email calls off an international conglomerate's bid to conduct Australia's largest seismic blast survey in search of gas in the Otway Basin.

title.children: Opponents celebrate as plan abandoned for major seismic testing off Victoria

image.altText: Cigdem Aslan smiles, standing in a suburban garden beside red and pink flowers.

props.synopsis: The daughter of an Australian woman arrested in Türkiye is calling on the federal government to help bring her mother home, saying the accusations against her are "categorically false".

title.children: Daughter pleads for release of Australian woman arrested in Türkiye over alleged terrorism links

image.altText: Tourist under umbrellas with Sydney Opera House in the background

props.synopsis: While September has been the driest month this year, Australia is on track for a fifth straight year of above-average rain, with forecasts predicting a wet end for 2024.

title.children: Australia on track for fifth consecutive wet year as weekend brings further rain to southern states

image.altText: Flames glow at night, illuminating a plume of dark smoke.

props.synopsis: The IDF has launched a fresh round of strikes in Lebanon's capital after earlier bombing residential blocks in Beirut's south, claiming they contained Hezbollah headquarters. Follow live.

title.children: Fresh round of Israeli strikes hits Beirut after massive explosions target Hezbollah leadership

image.altText: Heavy smoke rises above a residential building.

props.synopsis: Israel's military confirms it bombed several residential buildings in southern Beirut, claiming Hezbollah's "central headquarters" were embedded underneath.

title.children: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was target of blasts, Arab and Israeli media say

image.altText: A man speaks at a podium with his finger raised to make a point

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu uses an address to the United Nations General Assembly to send a warning to Iran and its allies, as calls for a ceasefire in his country's wars against Hezbollah and Hamas grow louder.

title.children: Netanyahu tells UN there is 'no place' in the Middle East that Israel's 'long arm cannot reach'

image.altText: A woman in glasses with cropped grey hair

props.synopsis: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong will use her address to the United Nations General Assembly to call for the international community to come together amid more conflict on Earth than any time since World War II.

title.children: Foreign Minister Penny Wong to warn UN General Assembly that world is 'enshrouded in darkness'

image.altText: A composite image of Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Labor's inability to come clean about who ordered the Treasury to work on negative gearing left the government and prime minister Anthony Albanese smeared as tricky, dissembling and guilty of treating voters with contempt.

title.children: 'What on earth just happened this week': 48 hours of confusion has backfired on Labor

image.altText: Ruby (right) and George (right) sitting with their cat cartier in their living room .

props.synopsis: Australians in Lebanon face flight cancellations amid growing hostilities between Hezbollah and Israel. Others who can't leave family behind are choosing to stay.

title.children: Australians in Lebanon face flight cancellations, leaving loved ones behind amid escalating tensions

image.altText: Maggie Smith, wearing a purple shirt, on a blurred background.

props.synopsis: Smith won an Oscar for The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie in 1970, and later won new fans as Professor McGonagall in the Harry Potter series and the Dowager Countess of Grantham in Downton Abbey.

title.children: 'Thank you Maggie': Daniel Radcliffe leads tributes to Harry Potter co-star Dame Maggie Smith

image.altText: NZF_0046 destroyed house Russia invasion odyssey

props.synopsis: After Ukraine launched a surprise assault on Russian territory in August, the ABC's Europe correspondent Kathryn Diss and camera operator Fletcher were invited by the military to visit an occupied town in Russia.

title.children: ABC crew becomes subject of Russian criminal investigation for crossing border from Ukraine

image.altText: Two men speaking

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy presents his "victory plan" to Donald Trump during a closed-door meeting, after the US presidential candidate vowed to work with both Ukraine and Russia to end their conflict.

title.children: Zelenskyy says 'very productive' talks had with Trump at New York meeting

image.altText: Police thumbnail

props.synopsis: Thousands of vacancies for police officers across Australia are making it harder for forces to protect the public, unions say.

title.children: Police are leaving the force 'in droves' with thousands of unfilled positions intensifying workloads

image.altText: A close-up of an elderly woman standing in the doorway of her caravan, wearing a striped shirt.

props.synopsis: Dozens of grey nomads bought houses in a caravan park on the promise it "couldn't be sold from underneath them". Then it was.

title.children: 'This must be a joke': Caravan park put up for sale without homeowners' knowledge

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment Group's shares bombed on Friday, losing close to half their already heavily discounted value, after the company narrowly avoided collapse, securing a last-minute $200 million bailout from its bankers.

title.children: How the end of money laundering sank Australia's casinos

image.altText: Captains Lachie Neale and Dane Rampe hold the AFL premiership cup during the grand final parade

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans stand-in captain Dane Rampe says he is hoping his unhappy grand final memories will help in his side's decider against the Brisbane Lions.

title.children: Rampe hoping that fourth time is the charm on grand final day

image.altText: Map showing location of a crash on a bend in a road on the Newell Highway near Dubbo

props.synopsis: NSW Police say two men believed to be aged in their twenties, and an older man and woman, ages unknown, died at the scene on Friday night.

title.children: Four people dead, Newell Highway closed near Dubbo after two-vehicle collision

image.altText: A Chinese woman offers a prayer in front of  flowers.

props.synopsis: The deadly stabbing of a 10-year-old boy in China has raised alarm among the Japanese community in the country while triggering a flood of criticism of the incident and extreme nationalist comments on Chinese social media.

title.children: Fatal stabbing of Japanese schoolboy in China sparks debate on the country's patriotic education

image.altText: A moving satellite image of a hurricane moving over the coast of Florida.

props.synopsis: The storm prompted hurricane and flash flood warnings extending far beyond the coast up into northern Georgia and western North Carolina.

title.children: Hurricane Helene cuts destructive path through southeastern US with at least 33 dead

image.altText: Liberal Troy Bell celebrates on election night

props.synopsis: Before a juror even set foot in the courtroom, the fraud trial of South Australian MP Troy Bell was one of the state's longest-running criminal prosecutions without a verdict. This is why it took so long.

title.children: Why it took almost a decade to prosecute a state MP

image.altText: A hand plugging a cord into the side of an electric car.

props.synopsis: Sales of hybrid cars in Australia have charged ahead of demand for electric vehicles, reflecting a global trend that has seen major car makers scale back their EV production targets. Here's what it could mean for Australian consumers.

title.children: Why hybrids are charging ahead of EVs in the battle for dominance in Australia's green revolution

image.altText: An infrared image of the Sydney Opera House.

props.synopsis: UNSW researchers have made a breakthrough for renewable energy production, demonstrating for the first time the ability to produce electricity from radiant infrared heat sources. The emerging technology could be powering our home appliances while we sleep within five years.

title.children: Night-time energy could power our appliances via an emerging technology developed by Sydney researchers

image.altText: A man holds a petrol bowser while filling up his car.

props.synopsis: Drivers in Adelaide, Brisbane, Melbourne, Perth and Sydney may be frustrated by trends in fuel prices, but they can use them to their advantage.

title.children: Petrol price cycles are dictating how much many drivers pay at the bowser. Here's how to beat the system

image.altText: Two people holding a puppy while getting vaccinated,

props.synopsis: The resort island is struggling to eradicate rabies despite the efforts of both the Australian and Indonesian governments.

title.children: Relaxed attitudes and stray dogs helping to spread rabies in Bali

image.altText: a pregnant woman lying on a couch holding her belly

props.synopsis: In what Health Minister Shannon Fentiman is hailing as an Australian first, the free tests will be for Rhesus D Haemolytic Disease — a condition that can cause stillbirth.

title.children: Queensland women whose babies are at risk of a condition that can cause stillbirth to get free testing

image.altText: A graphic shoes a wide shot of the house with a circle close up of a rotted beam.

props.synopsis: The Moreton Bay rental was listed for sale as needing "some TLC (or a bulldozer)". A few weeks later it sold for $590,000.

title.children: Tenant in 'sinking' rental evicted with 16 hours' notice despite it passing inspection months earlier

image.altText: An older man in a suit speaks as Pope Francis looks on.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Alexander De Croo's blistering welcome speech at the start of Francis's visit was one of the most pointed ever directed at the pope during a foreign trip, where diplomatic protocol usually keeps outrage out of public remarks.

title.children: Belgian PM and king blast Pope Francis for Catholic Church's legacy of covering up sexual abuse

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers talks National Accounts

props.synopsis: After days of speculation over who ordered public servants to take another look at the tax breaks, the treasurer has spoken up.

title.children: Jim Chalmers concedes he asked Treasury for negative gearing modelling

image.altText: Two women watching a woman sign Auslan in a pub with other people

props.synopsis: The founders say their events give people an opportunity to chat, practise and learn Auslan in a social setting.

title.children: Social group gives deaf people and those who want to learn Auslan safe space to connect

image.altText: A woman and girl stretching on a patch of grass while looking at each other

props.synopsis: When Maia Shoecraft was diagnosed with cerebral palsy as a toddler in a small rural town, her mum went back to university to help her.

title.children: Heidi was told her daughter would struggle to walk. Now she's a champion runner
